item.description:

item.title: Asian financial institutions are expected to see an average pay increase of 4% in 2016
item.description:

Asia and Latin America are projected to see average base pay increases of 4.3% in 2016, in contrast to 2% to 2.7% in Europe and North America. item.title: Introducing the Al Rabeh salary account by Kuwait Finance House
item.description:
Kuwait Finance House (KFH) has introduced the Al-Rabeh account, a salary account that offers customers chances to win valuable prizes like Range Rovers and gold each quarter. Al-Rabeh is also designed as an investment savings account, providing customers with annual dividends. This account caters to individuals who want to transfer their salaries and manage their personal finances while benefiting from savings and investment opportunities. The Al-Rabeh account is available in Kuwaiti Dinars (KD) and requires regular salary transfers to be eligible for prize draws...

item.title: A study conducted by INSEAD has discovered that when shareholders vote on CEO accountability, it leads to higher company returns
item.description:
A new study titled “Say Pays! Shareholder Voice and Firm Performance,” published in the Review of Finance, suggests that shareholder votes do improve CEO accountability and reduce unnecessary spending within corporations. The study’s author, Maria Guadalupe, an Associate Professor at INSEAD, found that previous research on the impact of “say-on-pay” policies was inconclusive, possibly due to focusing on periods after say-on-pay became law. Guadalupe’s research examined 250 instances where shareholders of S&P 1500 companies proposed to adopt say-on-pay policies between 2006 and 2010, before such votes were mandatory...
